intro: Hieracium curvatum, commonly known as the bent-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal rosettes of dark green, lobed leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming from June to August. Hieracium curvatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
